name: py-beautifulsoup4

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Beautiful Soup is a Python library for pulling data out of HTML and XML
files. It works with your favorite parser to provide idiomatic ways of
navigating, searching, and modifying the parse tree.

dependent_to.name: spectre
dependent_to.description:
The SpECTRE numerical relativity code. SpECTRE is an open-source code
for multi-scale, multi-physics problems in astrophysics and
gravitational physics. In the future, we hope that it can be applied to
problems across discipline boundaries in fluid dynamics, geoscience,
plasma physics, nuclear physics, and engineering. It runs at petascale
and is designed for future exascale computers. SpECTRE is being
developed in support of our collaborative Simulating eXtreme Spacetimes
(SXS) research program into the multi-messenger astrophysics of neutron
star mergers, core-collapse supernovae, and gamma-ray bursts.

dependent_to.name: py-torchbenchmark
dependent_to.description:
A collection of open source benchmarks used to evaluate PyTorch
performance.

dependent_to.name: py-gee-asset-manager
dependent_to.description: Google Earth Engine Batch Asset Manager.

dependent_to.name: py-grayskull
dependent_to.description: Project to generate recipes for conda packages.

dependent_to.name: py-pycbc
dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.

dependent_to.name: py-geeadd
dependent_to.description: Google Earth Engine Batch Assets Manager with Addons.

dependent_to.name: py-exhale
dependent_to.description:
Automatic C++ library api documentation generation: breathe doxygen in
and exhale it out.

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: py-beancount
dependent_to.description:
A double-entry bookkeeping computer language that lets you define
financial transaction records in a text file, read them in memory,
generate a variety of reports from them, and provides a web interface..

dependent_to.name: py-ford
dependent_to.description:
FORD, standing for FORtran Documenter, is an automatic documentation

dependent_to.name: py-datalad
dependent_to.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.

dependent_to.name: py-furo
dependent_to.description: A clean customisable Sphinx documentation theme..
